title: Why Ekko is So OP
body:
Every time Riot brings out a new champ, they are always slightly out of balance. Nine times out of ten this leads to a nerf the next patch followed by some tweaking over the next few patches until they get it right. 

But Ekko.

The most OP champ I've seen released yet. I've been playing ranked, hexakill, anything to ban him away. He's a mage that I've seen stick around for 3 consecutive team fights in our base with 0 mana regen items and yet still have enough mana to spam his OP skills. His stun nukes me as Ahri for 90% of my health and let's not even start talking about his ulti bs.

At first, I was mad. Why Riot, why? Don't you have beta testing to sort this **** out?? But then I had a revelation. 

Riot didn't nerf him because they couldn't.

Ekko is Jessy Perring's son.

replies.body:
It's understandable that a newly released champ can be out of the balanced zone, even though they already have the public testing realm for that purpose called PBE, but whatever I can forgive that.

Is Ekko balanced? I can not say and tbh, I don't really care if he is or not.

The problem I have with is his kit's design direction and philosophy.

"i His stun nukes me as Ahri for 90% of my health and let's not even start talking about his ulti bs."

If you are playing ahri and cant dodge his ult,slow or stun you are shit no questions
